titleStmt.title: An elegie upon the death of the most illustrious and victorious Prince Gustavus Adolphus King of Swethland &c. Composed immediately after the first rumours of his death, and now published and dedicated to the memoriall of so renouned a prince.
titleStmt.author: Russell, John, d. 1688.

titleStmt.title: An elegie upon the death of the most illustrious and victorious Prince Gustavus Adolphus King of Swethland &c. Composed immediately after the first rumours of his death, and now published and dedicated to the memoriall of so renouned a prince.
titleStmt.author: Russell, John, d. 1688.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "What strange sad silence, doth the world astound?".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: Gustaf King of Sweden, II Adolf,
